title: [BEAM-6779] fix DataflowRunnerTest expected error msg
body:
Was asserting on an error msg coming from an external GCS API, that apparently changed. New expected value comes from within Beam, I think. [Here's a full example of previous failing output](https://gist.github.com/ryan-williams/7c1a299d39f926f740e6c646e60a7ce4). title: [BEAM-6824] Add Element count transformer for Java worker FnApi
body:
[[BEAM-6824]](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-6824) This PR adds ElementCount MonitoringInfo to Dataflow CounterUpdate mapping in java worker. The metric name utilized in dataflow consists of PCollection name plus "-ElementCount" suffix. From FnApi SDK Harness we receive PCollectionId defined as value in ProcessBundleDescriptor PTransform outputs list. These two are mapped via ProcessBundleDescriptor.PTransform.Outputs(key)==(WorkItem.PTransform.Outputs.SystemName - PTransform Name Prefix). This PR follows this pattern for mapping MonitoringInfos to CounterUpdates. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-562] Add DoFn.setup and DoFn.teardown to Python SDK
body:
DoFn.setup and DoFn.teardown is currently supported in Java but not Python. These methods are useful for performing expensive per-thread initialization. This change adds those methods to make the Python SDK more consistent with the Java SDK. It also modifies the direct runner to invoke these methods. ## Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch) Lang | SDK | Apex | Dataflow | Flink | Gearpump | Samza | Spark --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Go | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Java | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Apex/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Apex/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/)

title: [BEAM-6751] Add KafkaIO EOS support to Flink via @RequiresStableInput
body:
This enables exactly-once support for the KafkaIO sink when using the Flink Runner. KafkaIO's KafkaExactlyOnceSink has been annotated with @RequiresStableInput which forces the Flink Runner to buffer pending elements until a checkpoint is completed. title: [BEAM-6685] [BEAM-6686] Create scaffolding for Spark portable runner
body:
This PR sets up the scaffolding upon which we can build a portable Spark runner. (It is very close to the structure of the Flink portable runner.) - I chose to put this on the master branch, rather than the [structured streaming](https://github.com/apache/beam/tree/spark-runner_structured-streaming) branch. The implementation details of how a pipeline is translated and run are not the focus of this PR; in fact, they are intended to eventually be switched out. - For now, the runner merely sets up a Spark context and attempts to translate/run a portable pipeline. It "fails as intended" because the map of translation functions is empty, left to be filled in by future PRs. title: [BEAM-6165] Flink portable metrics: get ptransform from MonitoringInfo, not stage name
body:
This fixes a problem with portable Flink metrics that dates back to #7183: the runner's "step name" is just the name of an executable stage, not the ptransform that metrics are actually part of (which come over the fn API in MIs' "ptransform" label). Metrics weren't properly tagged with the ptransform they came from until #7624; it wasn't possible to do the right thing before that. Versions of these Flink-specific changes exist in both #7915 and #7934, so I'm seeing about factoring them out here; if this is straightforward and can go in first, I can simplify those others by rebasing them on top of this. title: [BEAM-6755] Run BQ Storage tests in Dataflow in post-commit.

title: [BEAM-6670] Add option to disable reshuffling of JdbcIO
body:
Adds a `withReshuffle` method on JdbcIO classes so reshuffling can be disabled. This can be useful when an operator immediately after `JdbcIO.Read` reshuffles anyway. In my case I am first reading 20 or so tables and then joining them using a `CoGroupByKey`. Since the CoGroupByKey operation would distribute the data anyway, the work to reshuffle the 20 tables is wasted and results in a much more complex graph than necessary. There are no tests for this, as reshuffling is not easily testable as it should practically have "no effect". However, there are no tests for the original reparallelization logic either. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-6751] Extend Kafka EOS mode whitelist / Warn instead of throw
body:
The FlinkRunner supports exactly-once checkpointing but is blocked from using Kafka's exactly once mode. The list is hard to maintain and we should rather warn than throw in case of unsupported Runners. We generally have to rely on the Runner doing its work correctly and such checks do not prevent bad things from happening. title: [BEAM-1251] Fix Python 3 compatibility bug in pickler.py
body:
This issue was discovered while testing the pytest framework using Python 3 in #7949. sys.modules changes during iteration. It seems that the intention was to make a copy using sys.modules.values(), which returns a copy in Python 2, but a view in Python 3. The issue comes up when using pytest, which implements lazy module loading. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-3713] Add pytest testing infrastructure
body:
Initial step towards migrating off of nosetests. - Runs integration tests via tox: `tox -e py27-gcp-pytest,py36-pytest,etc.` - `@pytest.mark.{pre,post}commit` replaces `@attr('IT')` - Also can mark tests as: no_dataflow, no_direct, etc. to exclude tests that don't pass on certain runners. - conftest.py replaces BeamTestPlugin - Jenkins reports for all tests run (not just the last nosetests invocation), using multiple XML outputs. - Allows specifying test module in tox cmd line. Example: ```sh tox -e py27-pytest apache_beam.transforms.window_test ``` Still needs: - Verification that all the tests that run on nose also run on pytest. Nice to have: - Parallelization, but this requires fixing pickling issues with the pytest plugins used for this. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-6731] Bundle Java ExpansionService with Flink JobServer
body:
We need the Expansion Service to resolve cross-language transforms. This integrates the service into Flink's JobServerDriver which now provides all services to translate and execute pipelines. title: [BEAM-6619] [BEAM-6593] Add gcsio integration tests to postcommit
body:
This is is part of a series of PRs with goal to make Apache Beam PY3 compatible. The proposal with the outlined approach has been documented here: [https://s.apache.org/beam-python-3](https://s.apache.org/beam-python-3). This PR adds a more integration tests to the postcommit jobs on direct and dataflow runners. title: [BEAM-6725] share some Flink job invocation code with Samza runner
body:
- This PR assumes the extra layer of abstraction allowing runners to define their own execution wrappers was heretofore inflating maintenance cost, so I changed JobInvoker and JobInvocation from interfaces to classes to handle execution logic up until the pipeline is actually run. This means other portable runners will now share the Flink runner's future-based execution framework. - Unlike #6714, this change required modifications to the Samza runner. - Some of the helper methods remaining in FlinkPipelineRunner may also be reusable; if I find them useful to the Spark runner, I will move them to JobInvocation in a future PR. title: [BEAM-6733] Use Flink 1.6/1.7 prepareSnapshotPreBarrier to replace BufferedOutputManager
body:
For Flink version <= 1.5 the Flink Runner has to buffer any elements which are emitted during a snapshot because the barrier has already been emitted. This leads to a lot of code complexity. Flink version >= 1.6 provides a hook to execute an action before the snapshot barrier is emitted by the operator. We can remove the buffering in favor of finishing the current bundle in DoFnOperator's prepareSnapshotPreBarrier. The 1.5/1.6/1.7 build setup allows us to make this change with as little code duplication as possible. title: [BEAM-6705] Fixes ConcurrentModificationException in RowCoderGenerator
body:
After running ValidatesRunner test suite for Direct Runner using Java 11 I ran into a ConcurrentModificationException in `RowCoderGenerator.generate` method. The cause of the exception was a race condition in a pipeline in `ParDoSchemaTest.testReadAndWrite`, `ParDoSchemaTest.testReadAndWriteMultiOutput` and `ParDoSchemaTest.testReadAndWriteWithSchemaRegistry`, where `RowCoderGenerator.generate` (and, as a result, `HashMap.computeIfAbsent`) was called with the same arguments from different threads. This resulted in tests failing with the exception. Due to the fact that `HashMap.computeIfAbsent` now throws this exception if an external change is detected, it seems that the simplest solution is to change the map class to `ConcurrentHashMap`, which safeguards against such problems. @reuvenlax, WDYT? ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-6778] Enable Bundle Finalization in Python SDK harness over FnApi
body:
This PR is focus on supporting [Bundle Finalization](https://s.apache.org/beam-finalizing-bundles) in the Python SDK harness level. The finalizer API design is under discussing and would be changed in the future. 
In order to implement the finalization logic inside the sdk harness, there are some simplifications in other components:
1. For the finalizer API, it may be changed by upcoming PR.
2. For the Python Fnapi runner, it simply requests a finalization if the ```ProcessBundleResponse``` sets the ```requires_finalization``` to true.

R: @aaltay @robertwb

title: [BEAM-6738] Cache Combine Invokers.
body:
Applies the invoker caching optimization to Combines, as previously applied to ParDo. Change log * Caching the infrastructure for invoking user functions avoids repeated work and allocations as before, especially for shim generated functions. * Fix bug in the eviction code. title: [BEAM-4775] add GetJobMetrics RPC
body:
- Send metrics over the job API - new job API RPC depends on `MonitoringInfo` protos from the fn api - per discussion with @robertwb, I'm going to move `MonitoringInfo` into `model/pipeline`, to avoid introducing a [job API] → [fn API] dep - as such, **this PR shouldn't be merged as-is**; that proto move should happen first, but I wanted to get this out for Jenkins and first review pass - add Python and Java SDK support for portable metrics over the job API - portable python flink wordcount outputs the integer `empty_lines` metric! - Flink attempted counter PVR cases are now enabled R: @robertwb @ajamato CC: @mxm since I reworked the Flink metrics a bit in particular Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Lang | SDK | Apex | Dataflow | Flink | Gearpump | Samza | Spark --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Go | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Java | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Apex/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Apex/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/)

title: [BEAM-6735] Add noSpilling option to WriteFiles.
body:
Construct a simplified pipeline in the event that the number of writers isn't prohibitive. title: [BEAM-4468] Go SDK Combiner Lifting cache cap & eviction.
body:
Capping the LiftedCombiner cache to 2000 elements and when additional keys are added, randomly evict an old one to the next stage. This optimization is necessary for *very large bundles* which may happen for batch jobs. A random eviction policy was better than simply dumping the whole cache when the cap is hit. This implementation takes advantage of Go's built in Random Map Iteration to choose evictees. We can probably do better, but it's not a implementation I'd like the SDK to maintain, so that is deferred until adding dependencies is simpler. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-6819] Report estimated size as source metadata when splitting.
body: Currently, sources don't report SourceMetadata after successful splits; the serialization to a cloud Source omits metadata all together. This prevents Cloud Dataflow from understanding what the size of the resulting splits might be. Especially when subsources are concatenated together (per the split protocol), this results in potentially ambiguous scenarios where it's not feasible for Cloud Dataflow to infer the appropriate fraction of the input represented by a subsource. To help with this, this change populates the estimated size per source. To minimize the expense of calling getEstimatedSizeBytes per subsource, this change also modifies AvroSource to be built with single file metadata which allows it to efficiently compute its estimated size. Moreover, BigQuerySourceBase now leverages constructing Avro subsources using single file metadata.

title: [Beam-3208] Add Distinct PTransform to mirror Java SDK
body:
The Java SDK introduced a `Distinct` PTransform to replace the `RemoveDuplicates` PTransform. But, the Python SDK still had the `RemoveDuplicates` PTransform. **A new `Distinct` PTransform was added which does the same thing as `RemoveDuplicates`. `RemoveDuplicates` is now an alias to the `Distinct` PTransform and is deprecated.** JIRA Issue: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-3208 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [X] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: Use MonitoringInfo data model in Java SDK metrics
body:
- fold `MonitoringInfoMetricName` into `MetricKey` ({URN, labels}) - `MetricKey.stepName` is expanded to a `MetricLabels` map - `MetricContainerStepMap` is now keyed off `MetricLabels` - (existing use-cases just get a `PTRANSFORM` entry with the `stepName`) - `MetricName` is basically a MonitoringInfo URN - previously only modeled user metrics ({namespace,name}) - can now model system-metric URNs as well - `MetricResult` is like a full `MonitoringInfo` ({key, metric value}) - it also contains both "attempted" and "committed", which MonitoringInfo does not, but I'm addressing that elsewhere R: @ajamato, @Ardagan, @robertwb ## java/core → model-fn-execution dependency I waffled on #7867 due to making java/core depend on the `model-fn-execution` proto module. However, talking with @ajamato, it seems like we're ok with that. It *may* be possible to pull more java/core metrics classes (Metric{Key,Name,Labels,Container*}, {Counter,Distribution,Gauge}Cell, and maybe more) into runners-core/java, which already depends on the model-fn-execution protos module, and save adding the dep to java/core. Let me know if I should look into that. If not, someone should sign off on in particular on needing to add `org.apache.beam.model` and vendored gRPC to [this GCP module API surface test](https://github.com/apache/beam/compare/master...ryan-williams:mi-mk?expand=1#diff-e1f378c05ed380fffbfb99e0f819afabR59).
